titleStmt.title: Text encoding of professional library organizations' statements in response to racism at the 2019 ALA Midwinter Meeting

sourceDesc.p: Statements were originally posted on various platforms, including organization web sites, ALA Connect, and social media sites; the specific web location for each is identified in the statement metadata in the first generation (F1) of this XML document.

The document "Statements from ALA Units and Affiliates on Racism within ALA" posted by Diedre Conkling on ALA Connect on Feb 7 was used as the source of the statements list. Source: https://docs.google.com/document/d/13IQd6EZCN5Z670y5G-2bpkUMnqpOE9KeWv0YD2ig6os

projectDesc.p: This project is an encoding of statements issued by ALA, its divisions, sections, and other affiliates in response to the incidents of racism and harassment that occurred at ALA's 2019 Midwinter Meeting. The text has been encoded through a combination of manual markup and iterative XSL transformations, and the resulting data supports qualitative content analysis using XQuery.

samplingDecl.p: The following items, included in Conkling's list, were not part of the project for the reasons given: (1) ASERL: Statement from Yolanda Cooper, ASERL Board President, 2/5/19: http://www.aserl.org/; Reason for omission: Statement is no longer available at this link, and could not be found with a reasonable amount of searching. (2) GODORT Statement from the GODORT Steering Committee, 2/4/19: https://bit.ly/2E5oJh; Reason for omission: Statement is no longer available at this link, and could not be found with a reasonable amount of searching. (3) ALA President announces future EDI Efforts, 2/8/19: https://bit.ly/2RNffvf; Reason for omission: Not an explicit response to ALAMW 2019 incidents. (4) Educopia Institute: Making Community Spaces Safer..., 2/8/19: https://bit.ly/2BxFjoE; Reason for omission: Not produced by an ALA unit/affiliate.

body.p: [This Organization] voices our serious concern about the reported verbal abuse of [Anonymous Person], at [Event].

[This Organization] reasserts our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion at all meetings and events. We have a zero-tolerance policy towards harassment or intimidating and aggressive behavior. We strongly urge [Organization] to hold their [Organization] accountable to ensure a safe space for all who attend their conferences.

Incidents like these do not exist in a vacuum. We at [This Organization] are committed to do better by our community of librarians, and we insist that as our parent organization [Organization] take leadership to do the same.

We at [This Organization] condemn strongly the incidents of racist behavior that have been reported at the most recent [Event], the best known of which is the verbal attack on [Named Person] at [Event]. Other attendees have reported acts of aggression, exclusion, and racial profiling at this and previous conferences. This ongoing pattern of exclusionary behavior is absolutely unacceptable and completely contrary to our values as both a profession and an organization.

We fully support the action steps outlined by [Named Person] (1) [Link]. We note that in a statement issued on Thursday, January 31st, the [Organization] Executive Board has made at least some steps towards each of these requests. We urge [Organization] and the [Organization] Executive Board to continue to move forward in addressing the concerns of its members. Further, we request that, in the interest of transparency and accountability, the [Organization] Conference Services Office give regular accounts of incidents of racism, homophobia, and other bigotry reported at conferences.

The change we must see goes beyond simple "diversity": we must take a truly progressive approach to championing anti-racism in our actions. If we are to live up to the directive in the [Organization] mission statement to "enhance learning and ensure access to information for all," (2) [Link] we must do better. We must protect each other, we must respect each other, and we must value each other. If we will not do these things for each other, we cannot do them for our communities.

The [This Organization] Board of Directors has learned of racist, discriminatory, and harassing behavior at [Event] in [Place]. We would like to express our support to those who were harassed and discriminated against during this particular incident and to all those who have lived and worked too long in unsafe environments.

We would also like to renew our commitment to our statement on Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion and call upon [Organization] Executive Committee to quickly respond, reassess, and renew its commitment to their fourth strategic direction, through education and advocacy for our colleagues and our patrons.

It is more important than ever that we as [This Organization] and as librarians and library staff work on addressing the pervasive privilege and bias within our profession and association. It is our responsibility to continue this work so that we can continue to ensure “the right of access to information for people of all identities, backgrounds, ages, and abilities especially with regard to marginalized peoples.”

We should not – and do not – accept harassment, bullying or discrimination of any kind in our profession or the work of [This Organization]. These behaviors go against our values. Violations to our code of conduct will not be tolerated.
We established a code of conduct because we take the responsibility of being respectful to each other very seriously.
We send our sincere apologies to [Named Person] for what she went through at [Event], which is unacceptable and doesn’t align with our core values.

[Implied Person] and [Implied Person] met with [Named Person] in [Place] shortly before [Event] to share some nonpublic information about events after the incident in question. [This Organization] leaders deeply regrets any distress this caused; it was not the intent of [Implied Person] or [This Organization] to threaten [Named Person] in any way.
[Anonymous Person] who instigated the incident has resigned and the Executive Board has accepted his resignation.
We also offer our sincere apologies to members who also experienced violations of the code of conduct at [Event].
We want to recognize that this incident has caused a lot of hurt and we are working diligently to ensure that at all [This Organization] events participants are - and feel - respected.
The Executive Board will form a working group to look at [Event] and ways to make it a safer space up to its continued viability.
We will review the current code of conduct complaint process to make it stronger and more effective.
We will work on facilitated racial equity training for [Event] during [Event]; that training and the code of conduct will be built into [Organization] Orientation moving forward.

In collaboration with the Office for Diversity, Literacy and Outreach Services, we will coordinate online and in-person resources on equity, diversity and inclusion for all members and for [This Organization] staff members.

[This Organization] and [Organization] have developed resources [Link] to embed principles of equity, diversity and inclusion in the work library workers do; see specifics for 2018 here [Link]. Last October during [Event], the Executive Board voted to affirm that [This Organization] will apply a social justice framework to the [Organization] Strategic Directions [Link] for the next three-to-five years in the areas of Advocacy, Information Policy, Professional and Leadership Development, and Equity, Diversity and Inclusion. We are building on the 2019 [Program] about "White Fragility" [Link].

This work can be messy, it takes time, but the Executive Board strives to create a better association every day. We ask for your collaboration to help us break through the systems of oppression and do the right thing at the right time, each time, as it should be done.

[This Organization] has learned that various conference attendees conveyed experiencing inappropriate and unacceptable behavior, including displays of racism and discrimination, at [Event] in [Place].

An ethnic affiliate of [Organization], [This Organization] is an association committed to supporting the academic, professional, and personal efforts of [Protected Group]. It is disheartening to learn that as we near our 50th anniversary as an organization, we are still dealing with micro and macro aggressions that make the library profession difficult for many people of color to navigate.

In working with and for [Protected Group] we are cognizant of the systemic racism that affects the lives of marginalized individuals and acknowledge that, while people of color may reach leadership positions, we cannot dismiss the hostility and inequity that comes with being a person of color in a predominantly white profession, as well as the ways oppression impacts all minority groups.

[This Organization] urges [Organization] to address racism and discrimination in the profession, be it at the institutional level or at professional development convenings. As a beacon for information that is viewed globally, [Organization] must be the foundation for inclusion and respect for all. We ask that [Organization] take action, and support librarians of color who experience deliberate or unconscious discrimination, by taking all accusations or concerns regarding racism seriously. It requires further investigation and is a dialogue that must expand upon the program on 'White Fragility'.

[This Organization] stands with individuals who have been seen as anything other than their authentic selves recognizing that discrimination finds roots in all marginalized communities and across intersections of identity. We must not forget that while libraries are repositories and hubs for information and resources, they are also the cornerstone of the human condition where social justice plays a role in aiding in the quality of life for all.

[This Organization] asserts its commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as core values of [This Organization]. This commitment is deeply embedded in the mission of libraries and archives, and in the work we do as an institutional-member organization called upon to provide leadership in key issues and practices that define our profession.

The harassment and intimidation that occurred during the recent [Event] should be of grave concern to all in the profession and in the broader society. These events telegraph that we, as a society and a profession, are far from truly realizing the vision of racial equity that so many desire and that must be a core principle if we are to be a just and equitable society.

[This Organization] affirms its responsibility for providing resources and educating leaders in libraries and archives about the systemic barriers to achieving racial equity. [This Organization] recently adopted a code of conduct [Link] for our meetings and interactions, and we commit to bystander/ally training for the Board of Directors and staff to ensure that our meetings are welcoming, inclusive, and free of harassment or intimidation.

We will use this stark reminder of injustice as an opportunity for discussion and growth, so that we might strengthen our role in advancing equity and inclusion for all in our association and in our profession.
For members who are not aware of recent incidents of harassment at [Event] in [Place], [This Organization] would like to call attention to the [Organization] Executive Board’s response [Link].

As [This Organization] name implies, we recognize we have a obligation to model supportive and respectful [Functional Area] across the entire organization. [This Organization] affirms the efforts of [Organization] to uphold the Statement of Appropriate Conduct, and recognizes we have much to do to improve equity, diversity, and inclusion within [Organization]. [This Organization] members know how important it is both for [This Organization] and for our home institutions to combat bias, racism and harassment, so that through our organizations, we can all provide the best library or information services possible. [This Organization] will continue to emphasize the [Functional Area] competencies that support safe, supportive workplaces — Communication skills, Emotional intelligence, Ethics, Conflict management, Diversity consciousness, Professionalism and Self awareness — and will seek opportunities to make sure all our members feel this is their organization.
At the recent [Event], there were reports of violations of [Organization]’s Code of Conduct and the [Organization] Executive Board has released this statement [Link].

Like [Organization], [This Organization] is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all our members. In its 2018–2022 Strategic Plan [Link], the [This Organization] Board of Directors affirmed its commitment to equity, diversity, inclusion and social justice (EDISJ). This work requires persistent and vigilant efforts to speak out and take action against oppression in [Functional Area], in society, and within the library profession. To fully meet these goals, we must examine and test our systems for acting when we fall short of our aspirations, acknowledge gaps and shortcomings, and take action to do better. To this end, [This Organization] commits to: Supporting and participating in training and forums to address systemic racism in professional associations; Re-examining our own systems for developing and delivering inclusive and respectful programs and events, and for responding in a timely and transparent manner when incidents arise that violate the [Organization] Code of Conduct; Continuing and expanding training [Link] and resources that support equity, diversity, inclusion and social justice in [This Organization], [Organization] and our libraries; Equipping our members [Link] with tools, mentoring/coaching, learning opportunities, and other resources to advocate and apply EDISJ principles in their libraries and communities.

Please join [This Organization] leaders in reaffirming our commitment to equity, diversity, inclusion and advancing social justice in our libraries, our communities, and our association. We appreciate all your contributions and look forward to our work together.

[This Organization] expresses its support and stands in solidarity with [Organization] members who have experienced racism, discrimination, and microaggressions within our association, most recently, but certainly not only at [Event]. We are categorically opposed to the harassment and aggression toward people of color in our profession and our professional community, online and in person.

[This Organization] is also deeply concerned and disturbed to have been made aware of past instances of homophobic and bullying remarks directed at [Anonymous Person] during [Event]. We are equally categorically opposed to the harassment, bullying, and discrimination of our members, and people of all [Protected Group] and [Protected Group].

Recognizing and celebrating the wonderful diversity and intersectionality of voices and rich, lived experiences within the library community, and of the initial steps taken by [Organization] to address issues of equity, diversity, and inclusion through the efforts of the Office of Diversity, Literacy, and Outreach Services (ODLOS), [This Organization] acknowledges there is much more work to be done, and will continue to help create safe spaces for these voices to be heard and play an active role in our organization. In conjunction with ODLOS, and in solidarity with [Organization]’s five ethnic affiliates, [Organization], [Organization], [Organization], [Organization], and [Organization], [This Organization] will continue to work toward greater inclusion within our association and professional community in whatever capacity it can.

[This Organization] also calls on [Organization] to be more proactive and transparent in reporting instances of racism, bullying, and discrimination and the action taken to address these instances, to review and reinforce its code of conduct at all levels of the organization, and to provide opportunities for all members to participate in this review.

[This Organization] stands with the individuals who experienced racism and discrimination at [Event] in [Place]. We stand with those who preserve and celebrate all cultures. Racism and discrimination dishonor every culture.

As an ethnic affiliate of [Organization], [This Organization] is a membership action group that addresses the library-related needs of [Protected Group]. [This Organization] is committed to promoting true representations of [Protected Group] cultures, languages, and values. As [This Organization] reaches its 40th anniversary, we strongly support librarians of color. We urge [Organization] to address racism and discrimination in the profession at the institutional level and at all professional development meetings.

[This Organization] joins our fellow ethnic affiliates, [Organization], [Organization], [Organization], and [Organization], and offers our support to [Organization] in order to realize [Organization]’s future. [This Organization] appreciates the work of [Named Person] of the Office for Diversity, Literacy & Outreach Services for [Organization] and is committed to working with [Organization] to address racism, bias, and discrimination in our communities.

The [This Organization] Executive Committee is troubled by reports of racist, discriminatory, and harassing behavior at [Event] in [Place]. We support those who experienced harassment or discrimination at [Event]. We recognize that many in our profession have been marginalized, unrecognized, or put in intimidating environments. We believe that everyone needs to be heard and respected.

[This Organization] includes in its area of responsibility, service to [Protected Group]. [This Organization] affirms [Organization]'s fourth strategic direction of equity, diversity and inclusion, and the priorities set in the Equity Diversity and Inclusion Implementation Plan [Link]. [This Organization] urges [Organization] Management and the Executive Board to take quick action and provide leadership for the profession through education and advocacy.

[This Organization], [Organization], and the library profession must prioritize efforts to increase inclusion and respect for everyone. We are committed to supporting and acting on changes needed to make our profession and association truly inclusive.

[This Organization] would like to echo and support the statement [Link] sent earlier by [Organization] regarding the reported verbal abuse of [Anonymous Person] as well as to express concern about additional racist incidents at [Event] that were reported on social media.

[This Organization] affirms our commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion and would like to see [Organization] uphold their commitment to creating inclusive spaces throughout their conferences, including in programs, the exhibit hall, social events, and governance meetings. While having a Statement of Appropriate Conduct [Link] is critical to ensuring victims of harassment have recourse, what matters most is how victims and the accused are treated in the investigative process. That one victim felt that she was being silenced during the process is concerning. Greater transparency should be provided to members of [Organization]’s elected governance structures about how reports are handled while respecting the privacy of those involved.

We appreciate the [Organization] Executive Board’s statement [Link] and hope that it will ensure that structures are in place to address equity issues and limit racial trauma within our organization. We appreciate that both [Organization] and [Organization] are committed to providing anti-bias training for leaders and hope that this is extended to staff as well.

While our profession is focused on serving our diverse communities, there is a history in this country of libraries and librarians upholding racism. The lack of diversity of our own profession reflects this. We can all do more to confront racism in our libraries and professional organizations and [This Organization] is committed to this work as well.

The [This Organization] Board of Directors is aware that [Event] attendees have reported experiencing violations of the conference Code of Conduct, including incidents of racism, harassment, and discrimination. We laud the strength of those who have shared their experiences to draw needed attention to violations, and we abhor the systemic inequities in our profession that have normalized discriminatory, harassing, and racist behaviors.

As a division of [Organization], we are aware that [This Organization] also has work to do to address systemic racism and oppressive practices within [This Organization]. We recognize that [This Organization] is not as representative as it needs to be. [This Organization] has a core commitment to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion [Link] and recognizes the urgency of taking steps to create a responsive association that empowers all of its members. As part of our commitment, we have arranged anti-bias training for leaders and trainers within [This Organization] and funded additional [Program] for colleagues of color to join and thrive in the profession. We expect our leaders and members to be courageous in speaking against harassment or bullying behavior when they witness it.

Our commitment to a more equitable, inclusive, and diverse association leads us to strongly urge [Organization] to carry out the work it has promised to do in its statement [Link] and to set up town hall sessions with [Organization], the Executive Board, and the general membership, and to seriously reflect on enacting our professional values. Our profession needs to talk about the way that racism and systems that privilege whiteness have permeated our profession and our professional events. The [This Organization] Board, Conference planners, and staff will be reviewing plans for [Event] [Link] in [Place] to ensure that it is a safe and welcoming place for all.

This work is critical. We do it in service of building a more inclusive and equitable association and profession, and more inclusive and equitable libraries for our communities. We hope that all [This Organization] members will reaffirm the Board’s commitment to being advocates for our colleagues and advancing social justice in our communities and association.

[This Organization] expresses its support for the Black people and people of color who experienced racism and harassment at [Event] in [Place]. These incidents are not singular or isolated, and, coupled with the recent racial profiling and discrimination of Black future librarians at a university library in [Place] [Link] and a public library in [Place] [Link], illustrates that there is much work to do to address systemic discrimination, bias, power, and white privilege in our profession. While the [Program] at [Event] was on white fragility, and [Organization] often passes resolutions with statements that purportedly support marginalized communities, [Organization] itself as a member organization is frequently not a safe space for BIPOC; and [This Organization] calls on [Organization] to formally investigate some of the incidents that occurred during [Event].

[This Organization], one of the five ethnic affiliates of [Organization], is committed to “advancing social justice and providing opportunities for dialogue” and we strongly denounce these types of behavior, which create toxic environments for people of color. [This Organization] acknowledges the complexity of intersectional identities and how multiple systems of oppression such as racism, sexism, classism, ableism and heterosexism (among others) overlap and compound on the individual, and advocates for prioritizing the experiences and voices of marginalized groups, and engaging in difficult dialogues in order to create a more just, equitable, diverse, and inclusive organization.

[This Organization] calls for [Organization] to uphold its core organizational values of “ethics, professionalism, and integrity,” to commit to its key areas of diversity that are “…a fundamental value of the association and its members,” and to follow through on its commitment to engage with diversity in deeper ways. [This Organization] calls for [Organization] to engage with the five ethnic-affiliates of [Organization], [This Organization], [Organization], [Organization], and [Organization] to create meaningful and purposeful change through discussion and action, in order to make the profession more inclusive.

The [This Organization] Board of Directors is aware that there were several reports on social media from attendees who encountered aggressive behavior, racism, and harassment at [Event], which violated our values of diversity, equity, and inclusion, and that there were multiple incident reports filed, including one formal complaint regarding the violation of the Code of Conduct as well. We thank those who were able to share their experiences and draw attention to the systemic issues that our society and profession face. As an association with an unwavering commitment to the values of diversity, equity, and inclusion, [This Organization] believes that clear action is necessary and seeks partnerships within [Organization] and beyond to address these issues of systematic oppression.

It is our belief that safety, both physical and psychological, is a requirement for the full engagement of participants. [This Organization] is committed to ensuring, through policy and action, that the culture and activities of [This Organization] and [Organization] are safe and productive. We are therefore in agreement with the numerous expressions of concern and call for [Organization] to step up in leading our association and its members through the difficult but necessary work of dismantling system oppression within the profession, understanding differences, valuing those differences, and ultimately, learning how to communicate and innovate in an inclusive manner that welcomes diverse perspectives.

[This Organization] believes that education is a key component of this work. For this reason, we have decided to commit funds to the creation and dissemination of free bystander/allyship webinars. In collaboration with other units of [Organization], we will develop trainings that we hope will equip [This Organization] members with tools that empower active and effective allyship, recognize and undo oppressive behaviors and systems, and promote the practice of cultural humility, thereby collectively increasing our collaborative capacity.

As always, [This Organization] stands committed to the values of diversity, equity, and inclusion and welcomes opportunities to collaborate and partner with [Organization] and beyond in order to realize these values fully. We thank the [Organization] Executive Board and [Organization] for crafting an appropriate statement about racism and discrimination in the Library profession.

[This Organization] thanks [Organization], [Organization] Executive Board, [Organization] and [Organization] for crafting such appropriate statements against racism and discrimination in the Library profession, in response to conference attendees receiving inappropriate and unacceptable behavior during [Event]. We are in agreement with the expressions of concern and call for [Organization] to step up in leading our association and its members through the task of understanding, valuing differences and communicating respectfully. Education with conversation is an essential component to a journey of complete inclusion with fair and equal treatment for all. [This Organization] stands committed to these values and welcomes the opportunity to collaborate with the other affiliates and [Organization] to promote and provide cultural sensitivity training.

Many of you know about the incident of racialized aggression [Link] that [Named Person] experienced during the [Event] in [Place]. She was not alone; others, too, shared experiences of aggression during [Organization] events, this [Event] and earlier. These harmful experiences by people of color continue to be endemic to our profession and our professional associations.

In response, the [Organization] Executive Board [Link], the [Organization] Board [Link], and [Organization] [Link] (a [Protected Group] affiliate of [Organization]) have released statements condemning racism, harassment, and discrimination within the profession. Additionally, two [Organization] Councilors, [Named Person] and [Named Person] composed an open letter addressing racialized aggression [Link] in [Place]; both [Organization] Councilors and non-councilors are invited to sign.

We, the [This Organization] Executive Committee, are committed to cultivating an anti-racist ethos across [This Organization]. We do not speak on behalf of [Organization] or [Organization]. Rather, we are communicating the steps we will take as leaders within [This Organization] to enact our shared professional values.

We will commit our time slot for [Program] at [Event] to showcasing social justice work in [Functional Area]. We will hold a virtual town hall to acknowledge the continuing impact of racism on librarians and librarianship and organize collective action we can take to create anti-racist communities within the section and across [Organization]. Finally, we will arrange for training on anti-oppressive meeting facilitation to incoming [This Organization] committee chairs, committee members, and discussion group conveners.

We also want to hear from you. How can [This Organization] take action to become the kind of inclusive professional community each of us deserves? To share your thoughts with all members of the [This Organization]’s Executive Committee, please write to [This Organization] [Link]. You may also reach out to any of us individually.

[This Organization] was formed so that library workers engaged in [Functional Area] could see a place for themselves within [Organization] and [Organization]. Together we must make sure that the [This Organization] is a safe and welcoming community for all of our members. Let’s get to work.

In light of reports of incidents of harassing, discriminatory and racist behavior that occurred at [Event], the [This Organization] Board offers its support to the individuals who were the targets of such behavior and affirms the statement from the [Organization] Executive Board [Link] in its denunciation of such behavior, as well as its call to uphold [Organization]’s Statement of Appropriate Conduct [Link].

In particular, [This Organization] supports the goals in the Executive Board Statement to provide resources and training on equity, diversity and inclusion for all members and to apply a social justice framework to the [Organization] Strategic Directions. We hope to work with [Organization] to strengthen and improve the Statement of Appropriate Conduct and ensure its enforcement. [This Organization] also recognizes that words are not enough for this situation and must be transformed into action.

[This Organization] will review its own activities, both online and in-person, to determine what changes should be made to bring our actions in line with our rhetoric. [This Organization] is engaged in supporting equity, diversity and inclusion initiatives through work such as developing a code of ethics for [Functional Area], supporting the [Functional Area] needs of cultural heritage institutions through [Program], providing grants for library professionals from developing countries to attend [This Organization] online courses, supporting [Organization] Spectrum Scholars, and providing people from underrepresented groups with awards to attend [Event]. Our current activities, however, are just a starting point. Our new strategic plan, currently in draft form, includes explicit support for equity, diversity and inclusion as a core objective, promulgating the importance of EDI to all levels and activities within [This Organization]. [This Organization] will invest financial resources to put the commitments of the [This Organization] strategic plan and this statement into action. We believe in the adage that every budget is a moral document—it is both practically and symbolically important that we put money behind our work in this area.

Education and empowerment are key components of the work going forward. We will highlight the Statement of Appropriate Conduct at all [This Organization] meetings, we will ensure that participants are able to contact designated [This Organization] EDI resource representatives in case of conduct violations, and we will provide training to [This Organization] leaders to help them become skilled meeting facilitators who can intercede when behavior becomes problematic. In addition to strengthening [This Organization]’s support for EDI, we will pursue collaborations and partnerships with other [Organization] divisions and offices in support of these goals, including working with [Organization] and [Organization] to develop bystander/allyship webinars and other training.

[This Organization] remains committed to improving equity, diversity and inclusion within the profession and within [This Organization] and to eliminating incidents of harassment, racism and discrimination. This statement serves to reaffirm and redouble our efforts in this area.
